intro: Anomospermum chloranthum subsp. asplundii, commonly known as the Asplund's ghost tree, is a rare and endemic species native to the arid regions of Namibia. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its unique, gnarled trunk and sparse, leathery foliage. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are followed by clustered, fleshy fruits. It is adapted to survive in extreme drought conditions, storing water in its thick, woody structure. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and human encroachment.
